intro: Stachys palustris var. cinerea, commonly known as silver hedge-nettle, is a low-growing perennial herb native to wetlands and marshy areas of North America. It features dense, hairy foliage that is typically grayish-white to silver in color, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, pinkish to purple flowers in whorled clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer.
